title: Fix for plugin loading on ST3 + Windows
body:
In ST3, the script path is of the included module, in ST2 (Python2?) the path
is relative to the includee. Make the loading logic more flexible by looking
up 3 directories up from the current one, looking for the plugin.

title: Fix for working with python3 (ST3)
body:
shlex.split cannot handle bytes, and since python3 does not ignore anymore the b prefix of the strings (to the contrary of python 2.x), shlex.split will fail like this:
....
   opts += shlex.split(output[0])
  File "X/shlex.py", line 276, in split
  File "X/shlex.py", line 266, in __next__
  File "X/shlex.py", line 93, in get_token
  File "X/shlex.py", line 121, in read_token
AttributeError: 'bytes' object has no attribute 'read'

Thus it's required to decode the string.

title: using include-pch?
Panel doesn't show all errors (C++)
Autocompletions prefers Argumentlist
body:
Hi,
at the moment i am using Sublimclang with ST3, it works great except one thing. The autocompletion-fuzzy-search seems to prefer argumentlists.
If i want to create a vector (for example):
v  -> vector not shows up, thats ok
ve -> vector shows up, great
vec,vect,vecto,vector -> vector shows not up, since there is a function, where each letter is contained within the argument list. 
This seems a bit arkward, in my opinion "vector" should be preferred, at least as long, as all charakters are in the right order

title: ctypes can't be imported
body:
I have Ubuntu 12.10 amd64

I did follow the guide posted in here: http://www.sublimetext.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=6&t=9313

I couldn't install Python 2.6 so I installed 2.6.7 instead as was suggested in https://github.com/quarnster/SublimeClang/issues/35

'pythonbrew install --configure="--enable-unicode=ucs4" 2.6.7'

After this I followed the guide and completed the installation. When I start Sublime I still get the original warning: 

"Unfortunately ctypes can't be imported, so SublimeClang will not work.

There is a work around for this to get it to work, please see http://www.github.com/quarnster/SublimeClang for more details."

I did try some of the keyboard shortcuts listed in the README.creole but they didn't have any effect. What could have gone wrong?

title: Missing libcache.dylib
body:
I'm getting the following exception from sublimeclang.py when it tries to import translationunitcache :

dlopen(/Users/robpieke/Library/Application Support/Sublime Text 2/Packages/SublimeClang/internals/libcache.dylib, 6): image not found

Poking around, the file doesn't exist.

I'm happy to dig deeper, but I could use some advice on what to check. I'm very new to SublimeText, so I'm not sure what process is meant to create it.

Worth noting that this issue rears its head in a misleading way. The actual exception is caught back in sublimeclang.py which looks to be treating that block of code as a way to deal with "import Queue" vs "import queue". More specifically, I got an error on "import queue" because "import translateunitcache" had failed earlier.

Cheers!

title: Sublime Text 3: outline highlighting does not seem to highlight errors in the main code view.
body: Errors in the error panel are highlighted by an outline when the line of code with the arrow is clicked, however the code itself does not get highlighted.

title: Making a selection and typing is broken.
body:
To reproduce:

Select a small piece of text and press the space bar.  A space will be inserted after the selection, which is not the correct behavior. What should happen is the selection will be replaced with a space character.

If I disable SublimeClang, this bug stops happening.


Thanks for the great plugin!

title: [patch] Handle "const" specifier in "Find Implementation"
body:
First, an example to reproduce the problem. With the cursor over "matrix_cart" in 
```
uc_mat3
matrix_cart(
  sgtbx::rot_mx const& rot_mx) const;
```
the following implementation is not found,
```
  uc_mat3
  unit_cell::matrix_cart(
    sgtbx::rot_mx const& rot_mx) const
  {
    return orthogonalization_matrix()
         * rot_mx.as_double()
         * fractionalization_matrix();
  }
```
The regex search fails because of the "const" specifier. Hence I propose the following patch:
```
--- translationunitcache.orig.py	2013-02-11 13:09:05.000000000 +0100
+++ translationunitcache.py	2013-02-11 13:09:22.000000000 +0100
@@ -691,10 +691,10 @@
     def __init__(self, cursor, spelling, found_callback, folders, opts, opts_script, name="", impl=True, search_re=None, file_re=None):
         self.name = name
         if impl:
-            self.re = re.compile(r"\w+[\*&\s]+(?:\w+::)?(%s\s*\([^;\{]*\))(?=\s*\{)" % re.escape(spelling))
+            self.re = re.compile(r"\w+[\*&\s]+(?:\w+::)?(%s\s*\([^;\{]*\))(?:\s*const)?(?=\s*\{)" % re.escape(spelling))
             self.impre = re.compile(r"(\.cpp|\.c|\.cc|\.m|\.mm)$")
         else:
-            self.re = re.compile(r"\w+[\*&\s]+(?:\w+::)?(%s\s*\([^;\{]*\))(?=\s*;)" % re.escape(spelling))
+            self.re = re.compile(r"\w+[\*&\s]+(?:\w+::)?(%s\s*\([^;\{]*\))(?:\s*const)?(?=\s*;)" % re.escape(spelling))
             self.impre = re.compile(r"(\.h|\.hpp)$")
         if search_re != None:
             self.re = search_re
```

title: Fixed warnings when frameworks such as <Foundation/Foundation.h> were imported
body: A typo in the default build settings seems to have caused some frameworks to not be recognised by clang as system frameworks (i.e. Foundation.h and Cocoa.h).   This has caused an excessive number of warnings to be emitted when these frameworks are included.   This patch resolves the issue.

title: Autocomplete uses current selection if I don't want it to
body:
First of all - thanks for this amazing plugin.
I've been testing some C++11 features with it and while everything seems to compile fine, there's one issue I have with autocomplete. I was unable to find this issue in the list, but searching for it is kinda tricky. Here it goes:

Consider this:
std::tuple<int, int> foo;

Now I want to read the first element via std::get, so I write std::get, triggering autocompletion which will find what I need, but the first thing it finds is std::getchar(). Since I've already typed "get" anyway, I don't need the autocompletion at all. I *could* press escape here, but it would be a LOT nicer if I could just type < now, but unfortunately that will write std::getchar()<, which doesn't make sense.
There are two ways that would be a lot nicer:

1. Don't ignore the '<', it IS part of the template get function - therefore, it would be nice if it selected one of the actual get<>() definitions - it already suggests them anyway!
2. '<' will not autocomplete. Typing it will just close the box and I can continue to write the proper code.

I hope that this can be fixed - I know that autocomplete is part of Sublime so I don't know how much control you have here. Thanks.

title: Issue with gcc 4.7.2
body: I went to the SublimeClang settings to change some values under "option": []. I used macports to install gcc 4.7.2. I wanted to use this instead of /usr/include/c++/4.2.1/. I added some new values that were the location of c++ 4.7.2. When doing this it would not work. The plugin would still use the older version. I tried commenting out everything but the newer version, but it didn't fix it. The location for the new c++ files is /opt/local/include/*.

title: Trouble having clang see the project's own files
body:
I have a mid-sized C++ project with bunch of code files at the same level as the .sublime-project file, as well more code in some subdirectories.

I don't have any per-project settings.  I have some vanilla user-level settings 

  "options":
    [ "-isystem", "/usr/include",
      "-isystem", "/usr/include/c++/*",
      "-Wall"
    ],

The files that live in subdirectories (such as foo/bar.h) often refer to files at the top level (e.g. "#include baz.h"). In terms of compiling and running the project, this is fine, of course, but SublimeClang doesn't like it:

. . . .foo/bar.h:10,10 - Fatal - 'baz.h' file not found  

If i change to "#include ../baz.h", it works, but this is impractical for this decent-sized project.  Such a change would make the code more brittle, anyway, so I don't want to do it.  Any advice?  Thanks.

title: Configuring autocomplete
body:
Hi !
Is it possible to change some properties for the autocomplete when using SublimeClang.
For example, when any method is triggered like this one:
pthread_cancel(pthread_t __th)

I would like extra inner spaces like this:
pthread_cancel( pthread_t __th )

I think I'm missing something because I can't find what file to modify to do that.
Is it possible to do it ?

I hope this is the right place to ask, and sorry if it's not.

title: As-you-type static analysis doesn't work by default
body:
Ubuntu 12.10 x64.

After installing SublimeClang I noticed that static analyzer kicks in only when file is saved or built.
I messed with default settings and found that setting `"reparse_use_dirty_buffer": true` makes it better but still not as-you-type.

With `"reparse_use_dirty_buffer": true`, analysis is done when current file loses and regains focus, in addition to on-save analysis.

Is there something that needs to be done for static analysis to work on-the-fly?

![unnecessary_error.png](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/206775/2049/2b2dfcca-417e-11e2-8c7b-a277d45b2991.png)

title: Autocomplete candidates not listed in any order of relevance
body:
In my experience with SublimeClang on my codebase, I find that it often suggests autocompletion candidates that are only remotely relevant. In certain files, it usually fails to autocomplete to the thing I want until I have almost typed everything. Here's an example:
http://i50.tinypic.com/w0oppi.jpg

This is within a class that has a superclass that has a member function placeFoo, but placeFoo is nowhere to be found in the view, but instead a lot of other things from other further lexical scopes. For example, the inplace_merge is there because I have a "using std;"

I also notice that sometimes, autocomplete will move the cursor to a candidate of which the string I typed is only a subsequence (string appears in longer string interleaved by other characters), not a substring (string appears in longer string as consecutive characters), but the candidate I am hoping it picks is a superstring. E.g. I type 'abc, hoping it would suggest abcde, but instead it highlights xabyc.

Can we have the autocompletion list sorted in some way, and have the selection be smarter about selecting probable candidates? This is especially important for large projects where the autocompletion candidates tend to be more numerous. I have a fairly large project different parts of which include various boost libraries. The effect is that when a given .cpp includes .hpp from the project, it pulls in a huge vocabulary from which to autocomplete. As a first cut, perhaps it can ignore supersequence matches in favor of superstring matches after the first 2-3 characters if there are superstring matches, or favor local variables and class members, listing them first, too.

title: error in dlopen libcache.dylib
body:
Today, I got error message and can't use SublimeClang function.
It seems that it upgraded and got an error

I checked Sublime's console and got following error message

Reloading plugin /Users/mrhjkim/Library/Application Support/Sublime Text 2/Packages/SublimeClang/translationunitcache.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./sublime_plugin.py", line 62, in reload_plugin
  File "./translationunitcache.py", line 93, in <module>
    cachelib = get_cache_library()
  File "./translationunitcache.py", line 44, in get_cache_library
    return cdll.LoadLibrary('libcache.dylib')
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.6/lib/python2.6/ctypes/__init__.py", line 423, in LoadLibrary
    return self._dlltype(name)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.6/lib/python2.6/ctypes/__init__.py", line 345, in __init__
    self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
OSError: dlopen(libcache.dylib, 6): Library not loaded: /usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/mrhjkim/Library/Application Support/Sublime Text 2/Packages/SublimeClang/libcache.dylib
  Reason: image not found

when I checked libcache.dylib by objdump, it need /usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib but there is no such file in my /usr/lib

I'm using OS X 10.6.8

any ideas to fix this problem?

title: File not found
hide_output_when_empty bugfix
body:
A bugfix related to my issue: #169

Sorry, but here is a 'typo' in the commit message it should be:

Bugfix: close panel if "hide_output_when_empty" is true and there were diagnostic messages but all was ignored (because of "diagnostic_ignore_regex" for example)

Improvement: "diagnostic_ignore_regex" can be disabled by setting it to empty string
